file_insights.changes: Added useLocale hook import and integrated locale context into date/time formatting
file_insights.significance: Localization improvement - replaced hardcoded 'en-US' locale strings with dynamic locale from context

patterns_discovered.description: Using toLocaleDateString() and toLocaleTimeString() with dynamic locale parameter instead of hardcoded locale strings
patterns_discovered.rationale: Enables multi-language support by respecting user locale settings globally

patterns_discovered.description: useLocale() hook imported and used at component level to access locale context
patterns_discovered.benefit: Decouples locale management from component, improves reusability

gotchas_discovered.description: JavaScript Intl API locale parameter accepts language tags (e.g., 'en-US', 'fr-FR') not arbitrary strings
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure useLocale() hook returns properly formatted BCP 47 language tags

gotchas_discovered.description: toLocaleDateString() and toLocaleTimeString() behavior varies across browsers for edge case locales
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Test date/time formatting across target browser versions

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully replaced hardcoded 'en-US' locale strings with dynamic locale from useLocale hook
quality_indicators: Consistent locale usage across two Intl calls

recommendations.suggestion: Verify useLocale() hook returns valid BCP 47 language tags to prevent Intl API errors
Add tests for date/time formatting with different locale values (en-US, fr-FR, de-DE, etc.)
Search codebase for other hardcoded locale strings in date/time operations and apply same pattern
Document the locale context behavior and expected format of locale parameter in useLocale hook documentation
